info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 3:02PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN JEFFERSON... SOUTHERN COLUMBIANA...NORTHEASTERN CARROLL...WESTERN BEAVER AND HANCOCK COUNTIES THROUGH 345 PM EDT... At 302 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southwest of Lisbon, or 12 miles northeast of Carrollton, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... East Liverpool, Beaver Falls, Wellsville, Calcutta, Ohioville, Lisbon, Midland, Chester, Industry, New Cumberland, Shippingport, Patterson Township, Big Beaver, Augusta, Salineville, West Mayfield, Newell, Patterson Heights, Hanoverton, and Irondale. This includes Interstate 376 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 29 and 37. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for east central Ohio...western Pennsylvania...and northern West Virginia.
